definition: to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])
a staff/a rod/cane/walking stick/to flog with a stick (old)

sentences.english: He shouted and rapped with his walking stick on the door.
sentences.chinese: 他边喊着边用拐杖敲着门。

sentences.english: With these, and a pair of crutches for back-up, a user can walk around.
sentences.chinese: 有了这些和一对拐杖帮忙，使用者可以走动。

sentences.english: Make up your mind, you’ll never use crutches or a stick, then have a go at everything.
sentences.chinese: 下定决心之后，你就永远不会需要拐杖或者棍子。

sentences.english: "Crutches are in very high demand," said the spokesman.
sentences.chinese: “拐杖供不应求，”这位发言人说。

sentences.english: She believed that comfort, not bread, was the staff of life.
sentences.chinese: 她相信，安慰虽不等于面包，却是生活的拐杖。

sentences.english: He is slower than a snail and uses a walkingstick.
sentences.chinese: 他行动起来比蜗牛还慢，总是拄着拐杖走路。

sentences.english: We also offer wheelchair and walking stick. Please contact the Luggage Room if you need.
sentences.chinese: 饭店备有轮椅车和拐杖，如需使用请与行李房联系。

sentences.english: He played nicknack on my sticks.
sentences.chinese: 在我的拐杖上摆弄他的小玩意儿。

sentences.english: When he broke his leg he had to walk on crutches.
sentences.chinese: 他摔断腿后，只好柱着两根拐杖走路。

sentences.english: The old man limped away on the stick.
sentences.chinese: 老人拄着拐杖一瘸一拐地走开了。

sentences.english: Use crutches to keep from walking with the foot.
sentences.chinese: 用拐杖支撑，避免用脚走路。

sentences.english: Not allowed to put weight on my leg for eight weeks, I wobbled about on crutches.
sentences.chinese: 为了不让受伤的腿承重，我拄拐杖拄了8个星期。

sentences.english: He entered walking easily and without crutches.
sentences.chinese: 他不拄拐杖，行动自如地走了进来。

sentences.english: He walks by a walking stick for he has one lame leg.
sentences.chinese: 他的一条腿跛了，走路借助于拐杖。

sentences.english: When the right heart was involved, it looked like "walking stick head" or "snakeheads".
sentences.chinese: 累及右心腔时可见似“拐杖头”或“蛇头”状改变。

sentences.english: A father is a walking stick, let us in life less tumble.
sentences.chinese: 父爱是拐杖，让我们在人生中少摔跟头。

definition: to walk unsteadily/to stagger/to lurch/to hobble/to totter
